originalText.text:
My experience at Upper East Side was exceptional. I'd previously taken my inherited 3 signed Graff pieces - a diamond ring, an exquisite necklace, and a pair of statement earrings to a well-known auction house, only to be met with dismissive appraisals. Upon reading about Upper East Side Fine Jewelry, I decided to try my luck once more.

From the outset, their team treated me like royalty. Unlike other establishments, there was no attempt to get me to sell. By the end of my consultation, I was thrilled with their generous offer. Great bunch of guys work here.

originalText.text:
I'd been holding onto a family-inherited diamond necklace, once featured in a big magazine article about historic jewelry. A friend recommended UES Fine Jewelry. With a bit of fear, I met with their expert. Immediately, I felt at ease. Their offer was generous. Unlike other establishments, there were no games; just a genuine care for their clients and an undeniable honesty about the piece's value.

UES Fine Jewelry has not just earned my trust, but that of my family and inner circle.

originalText.text:
Engaging with UES Fine Jewelry was enlightening. After my father’s passing, I inherited a unique diamond, set in a modest setting just as a placeholder. It was a complicated piece.

I was really scared they would hurry the transaction or give me a demeaning offer. My fears were unfounded. Their appraisal truly reflected its worth.

I now feel a sense of closure, confident that my father's diamond found the right home.

originalText.text:
I inherited many precious jewelry pieces last year. Ever since, I was on the hunt for a non-auction house that knows what they are talking about. This place delivered. They gave me a run-down on every nuance of my jewelry's history.

My standout piece, a 4-carat diamond necklace, was treated with the reverence it deserved. This wasn't just another transaction for them. They care about doing the right thing.

My deepest appreciation to the entire team at UES Jewelry, and a special mention to Daniel.

originalText.text:
I had the honor of visiting this jewelry appraiser last week. After reading a compelling article about them, I decided to schedule an appointment. I brought along a Tiffany and Bvlgari pieces for appraisal.

The whole visit was actually fun. It was totally transparent and they appraised the pieces right before my eyes. I decided to sell because I was worried that any future offers may be less.

Daniel was fun to talk to. Our conversation wandered from the world of jewelry to art and global affairs. He was honest and that’s all I care about. I will be visiting them again.
